post-types.title: Scripts
post-types.description: Text documents meant to be read out loud.

post-types.title: Audio Recordings
post-types.description: The actual sound files and their technical details.

post-types.title: Audio Transcriptions
post-types.description: The written-out text of what was said in a recording.

post-types.title: Audio Translation
post-types.description: Text translated from the original language into a new one.

post-types.title: Releases
post-types.description: Albums, EPs, or Singles prepared for public distribution.

post-types.title: Contributors
post-types.description: People who helped create the work, like authors or performers.

taxonomies.title: Audio Statuses
taxonomies.description: Shows if the file is new, being worked on, or finished.

taxonomies.title: Languages
taxonomies.description: The language spoken or written in the file.

taxonomies.title: Projects
taxonomies.description: Groups files together into larger collections.

taxonomies.title: Dialects
taxonomies.description: Different ways of speaking the same language in different places.

taxonomies.title: Audio Quality
taxonomies.description: How clear and easy to hear the recording is.

taxonomies.title: Genres
taxonomies.description: The type of music or story (like Rock, Jazz, or Comedy).

taxonomies.title: Workflow Status
taxonomies.description: Shows if the work is just started, in progress, being checked, or done.

taxonomies.title: Moods
taxonomies.description: The feeling the content gives you (like Happy, Sad, or Scary).

taxonomies.title: Themes
taxonomies.description: The main topic or idea (like Friendship or Space Travel).

taxonomies.title: Part of Speech
taxonomies.description: The type of word (Noun, Verb, Adjective).

taxonomies.title: Subject
taxonomies.description: What the text is about or talks about.

taxonomies.title: Story Type
taxonomies.description: The kind of story being told (like fairy tale, interview, or speech).

fields.label: Primary Genres (Max 2)
fields.name: starmus_assigned_genres
fields.instructions: Pick up to 2 types of music or story that best match this recording. For example: Rock and Pop, or Comedy and Drama.

fields.label: Mood (Select 1)
fields.name: starmus_assigned_mood
fields.instructions: Choose the main feeling this recording gives. Pick just one, like Happy, Sad, or Exciting.

fields.label: Theme (Select 1)
fields.name: starmus_assigned_theme
fields.instructions: Pick the main topic or idea of this recording. For example: Love, Adventure, or History.

fields.label: Workflow Status
fields.name: starmus_assigned_workflow_status
fields.instructions: Update where this is in the process. For example: Started, In Progress, Being Reviewed, or Finished.

fields.label: Part of Speech
fields.name: starmus_assigned_pos
fields.instructions: The type of word this is. For example: Noun (person/place/thing), Verb (action), or Adjective (describing word).

fields.label: Subject
fields.name: starmus_assigned_subject
fields.instructions: Check all the topics that show up in this recording. You can pick as many as you need.

fields.label: Story Type
fields.name: starmus_assigned_story_type
fields.instructions: What kind of story is this? For example: Interview, Fairy Tale, Personal Story, or Speech.

fields.label: Display Name (Legal)
fields.name: sparxstar_legal_name
fields.instructions: The person's full real name as it appears on legal documents like a birth certificate or ID.

fields.label: Contact Email
fields.name: sparxstar_email
fields.instructions: The email address where we can reach this person. Make sure it's typed correctly.

fields.label: Website / Portfolio
fields.name: sparxstar_website
fields.instructions: A web link to their personal website or portfolio showing their work. Must start with http:// or https://

fields.label: Linked WP User
fields.name: sparxstar_wp_user
fields.instructions: If this person has a login account for this website, select their username here.

fields.label: IPI / CAE Number
fields.name: sparxstar_ipi_number
fields.instructions: A special ID number used to pay music royalties. Usually looks like: 00123456789. Only needed for songwriters and composers.

fields.label: Directions and Instructions
fields.name: starmus_instructions
fields.instructions: Write notes about how the speaker should sound. For example: 'Speak slowly and calmly' or 'Sound excited and happy'.

fields.label: Performance Mode
fields.name: starmus_performance_mode

choices.conversational: Conversational - Like talking to a friend
choices.announcer: Announcer - Like a professional news reader

fields.instructions: Pick how the speaker should act when reading this.

fields.label: Energy Level
fields.name: starmus_energy_level
fields.instructions: Should the speaker sound calm or excited?

fields.label: Visual Density
fields.name: starmus_visual_density
fields.instructions: How many words should appear on the screen at once when someone is reading along.

fields.label: Source Script
fields.name: starmus_script_parent
fields.instructions: Connect this script to the audio recording that was made from it.

fields.label: File Integrity Status
fields.name: starmus_asset_health

choices.missing: ❌ Missing File - Cannot find the file
choices.verified: ✅ Verified - File checked and confirmed good

fields.instructions: Shows if the file is working correctly or if there's a problem with it.

fields.label: Last Health Check
fields.name: starmus_last_fixity_check
fields.instructions: The last time the computer checked if this file was safe and working properly. This is filled in automatically.

fields.label: File Fingerprint
fields.name: starmus_file_hash
fields.instructions: A special code that shows if someone changed the file. Like a fingerprint for the file.

fields.label: Cloud Fingerprint (ETag)
fields.name: starmus_cloud_etag
fields.instructions: The tracking number used by online storage to keep track of this file. Filled in automatically.

fields.label: Original Ingest Source
fields.name: starmus_source_origin
fields.instructions: Where did this file come from originally? For example: 'Uploaded from iPhone' or 'Recorded in Studio A'.

fields.label: Asset Event Log (JSON)
fields.name: starmus_asset_audit_log
fields.instructions: A computer-generated list showing every time this file was moved, copied, or changed. This is created automatically by the system.

fields.label: Copyright Status
fields.name: starmus_copyright_status

choices.public_domain: Public Domain - Free for anyone to use
choices.cc: Creative Commons - Free with some rules

fields.instructions: Who owns the legal rights to this work? This controls who can use it and how.

fields.label: Usage Rules
fields.name: starmus_usage_constraints

choices.no_ai: No AI Training - Cannot be used to teach computers
choices.no_comm: No Commercial Use - Cannot be used to make money

fields.instructions: Check any special rules about how people can use this work.

fields.label: Project Credits
fields.name: starmus_project_credits
fields.instructions: A list of everyone who helped make this. Add each person and their job.

sub_fields.label: Contributor
sub_fields.name: starmus_credit_contributor
sub_fields.instructions: Pick the person from the list.

sub_fields.label: Role
sub_fields.name: starmus_credit_role

choices.author: Author - Wrote the words
choices.narrator: Narrator - Read the words out loud
choices.editor: Editor - Fixed mistakes and improved it

sub_fields.instructions: What job did they do on this project?

fields.label: Global Unique ID
fields.name: starmus_global_uuid
fields.instructions: A special computer code that identifies this file everywhere in the world. This code is created automatically and never changes.

fields.label: Creator/Author
fields.name: starmus_dc_creator
fields.instructions: The name of the main person who created this work. This is the artist, writer, or speaker.

fields.label: Copyright Licensor
fields.name: starmus_copyright_licensor
fields.instructions: The person or company that gave permission for us to use this. Pick from the Contributors list.

fields.label: Copyright Licensee
fields.name: starmus_copyright_licensee
fields.instructions: The person or company receiving permission to use this work. Usually this is your organization name.

fields.label: Date Created/Recorded
fields.name: starmus_date_created
fields.instructions: The day this recording was made or when this text was written. Pick the date from the calendar.

fields.label: License Type
fields.name: starmus_rights_type
fields.instructions: What kind of legal agreement is being used? For example: 'Exclusive License' or 'Creative Commons BY-NC'.

fields.label: Licensed Use
fields.name: starmus_rights_use
fields.instructions: Explain exactly how this file can be used. For example: 'Can be used in videos' or 'Only for education'.

fields.label: License Geography
fields.name: starmus_rights_geo
fields.instructions: Where in the world is this license valid? Where can people use this?

fields.label: Royalty Split
fields.name: starmus_rights_royalty
fields.instructions: Describe how money from this work will be shared. For example: '50% to creator, 50% to platform'.

fields.label: Permanent Web Link
fields.name: starmus_stable_uri
fields.instructions: A web address for this file that will never change. This helps people find it in the future. Must start with http:// or https://

fields.label: Linked Data URI
fields.name: starmus_linked_data_uri
fields.instructions: A link to this same information in another system, like Wikidata or MusicBrainz. Leave blank if you don't have one.

fields.label: Data Classification
fields.name: starmus_data_classification
fields.instructions: Settings that control privacy and how this data can be used. This protects people's information.

sub_fields.label: Consent Scope
sub_fields.name: starmus_consent_scope

choices.educational: Educational Use - Can be used for teaching
choices.ai_training: AI Model Training - Can teach computers
choices.cultural_display: Cultural Display - Can be shown in exhibits
choices.internal_only: Internal Research Only - Private, for our use only

sub_fields.instructions: Check what the person agreed to let us do with this data. Only use it for things they said yes to.

sub_fields.label: Data Sensitivity Level
sub_fields.name: starmus_data_sensitivity

choices.restricted: Restricted - Only some people can see this
choices.confidential: Confidential - Very private, very few people can see

sub_fields.instructions: How private is this information? Who should be able to see it?

sub_fields.label: Anonymization Status
sub_fields.name: starmus_anon_status
sub_fields.instructions: Turn this on if personal details (like names) have been removed or hidden to protect privacy.

fields.label: Provenance (Audit Trail)
fields.name: starmus_revision_history_json
fields.instructions: A detailed history showing who changed this file and when. This is created automatically by the computer to keep track of changes.

fields.label: Project / Collection ID
fields.name: starmus_project_collection_id
fields.instructions: The ID number or name of the project or folder this recording belongs to. This helps organize related files together.

fields.label: Accession Number
fields.name: starmus_accession_number
fields.instructions: The official library or archive number for this item. Like a library book call number.

fields.label: Session Date
fields.name: starmus_session_date
fields.instructions: The day this recording session happened. Pick from the calendar.

fields.label: Session Start Time
fields.name: starmus_session_start_time
fields.instructions: What time did the recording start? For example: 2:30 PM.

fields.label: Session End Time
fields.name: starmus_session_end_time
fields.instructions: What time did the recording finish? Must be after the start time.

fields.label: Location
fields.name: starmus_session_location
fields.instructions: Where did the recording happen? For example: 'Studio A, New York' or 'Lincoln Elementary School, Room 205'.

fields.label: GPS Coordinates
fields.name: starmus_session_gps
fields.instructions: The exact location on a map where the recording was made. Click on the map to set the location.

fields.label: Subject (Contributor)
fields.name: starmus_subject_contributor
fields.instructions: The main person being recorded, interviewed, or performing. Pick from the Contributors list.

fields.label: Interviewers / Recorders
fields.name: starmus_interviewers_recorders
fields.instructions: The people who ran the recording equipment or asked interview questions. You can pick multiple people.

fields.label: Recording Equipment
fields.name: starmus_recording_equipment
fields.instructions: List the microphones, recorders, and other equipment used. For example: 'Shure SM58 microphone, Zoom H6 recorder'.

fields.label: Audio Files (Originals)
fields.name: starmus_audio_files_originals
fields.instructions: Upload the original, unedited audio files here. You can upload multiple files. Allowed types: MP3, WAV, AIFF, FLAC, M4A.

fields.label: Media Condition Notes
fields.name: starmus_media_condition
fields.instructions: Write notes about the recording quality. For example: 'Some background noise from traffic' or 'Very clear, no problems'.

fields.label: Access Level
fields.name: starmus_access_level

choices.public: Public - Anyone can see or hear this
choices.restricted: Restricted - Only approved people can access
choices.embargoed: Embargoed - Hidden until a future date

fields.instructions: Who should be allowed to see or listen to this file?

fields.label: Audio Quality Score
fields.name: starmus_audio_quality_score
fields.instructions: Rate how good the audio sounds. Is it clear and easy to hear, or are there problems?

fields.label: Recording Metadata
fields.name: starmus_recording_metadata
fields.instructions: Extra computer information about the recording session. This is filled in automatically by the system.

fields.label: Is Music?
fields.name: starmus_is_music
fields.instructions: Turn this on if this is a song or musical performance. Leave it off if this is talking, like an interview or speech.

fields.label: Parental Permission Slip
fields.name: starmus_parental_permission_slip
fields.instructions: Computer data from the digital permission form signed by a parent or guardian. This is created automatically when a parent gives permission.

fields.label: School Reviewed
fields.name: starmus_school_reviewed
fields.instructions: Information showing that a school official reviewed and approved this. Created automatically by the system.

fields.label: Contributor Verification
fields.name: starmus_contributor_verification
fields.instructions: Proof that we checked the person's identity. This is created automatically when we verify who someone is.

fields.label: QA Review
fields.name: starmus_qa_review
fields.instructions: Results from quality control checks. This shows if the recording passed our quality tests. Created automatically.

fields.label: Transcribed Metadata
fields.name: starmus_transcribed_metadata
fields.instructions: Computer information about when and how the text was typed out from the audio. Includes timestamps and version numbers.

fields.label: Transcriber Metadata
fields.name: starmus_transcriber_metadata
fields.instructions: Information about who or what computer program typed out the words from the audio.

fields.label: Translated Metadata
fields.name: starmus_translated_metadata
fields.instructions: Computer information about when and how the text was changed into a different language.

fields.label: Translator Metadata
fields.name: starmus_translator_metadata
fields.instructions: Information about who or what computer program changed the words into another language.

fields.label: AI Training
fields.name: starmus_ai_training
fields.instructions: Records showing if this file was used to teach a computer or AI. Created automatically by the system.

fields.label: AI Trained
fields.name: starmus_ai_trained
fields.instructions: A list of which computer programs or AI models learned from this file. Filled in automatically.

fields.label: Waveform Data
fields.name: starmus_waveform_json
fields.instructions: Computer code that draws the sound wave picture in the audio player. This is created automatically.

fields.label: Original Source File
fields.name: starmus_original_source
fields.instructions: The very first audio file we got, before any changes were made. Upload the raw, unedited file here.

fields.label: Archival WAV File
fields.name: starmus_archival_wav
fields.instructions: The highest quality version saved for long-term storage. Should be a WAV file. This is the master copy we keep forever.

fields.label: Mastered MP3 File
fields.name: starmus_mastered_mp3
fields.instructions: A smaller, compressed file that's easier to share and listen to. Should be MP3 format. This is what most people will hear.

fields.label: Cloud Storage Link
fields.name: starmus_cloud_object_uri
fields.instructions: The web address where this file is stored in the cloud (like Amazon S3 or Google Cloud). Created automatically.

fields.label: Audio Processing Log
fields.name: starmus_processing_log
fields.instructions: Notes from the computer about how the audio was edited, cleaned up, or changed. Created automatically by the system.

fields.label: Device Fingerprint
fields.name: starmus_device_fingerprint
fields.instructions: A code that identifies the specific computer, phone, or device that was used. Created automatically for security.

fields.label: Environment Snapshot
fields.name: starmus_environment_data
fields.instructions: Computer information about the room or place where this was recorded. Created automatically by sensors and software.

fields.label: Authorized Signatory (Contributor)
fields.name: starmus_authorized_signatory
fields.instructions: The person who signed the legal agreement. Pick their name from the Contributors list.

fields.label: Terms Type
fields.name: starmus_terms_type

choices.Submission: Recorded Submission Terms - Simple agreement for recordings

fields.instructions: Which type of contract did they sign? Pick the one that matches what they agreed to.

fields.label: Signature File
fields.name: starmus_contributor_signature
fields.instructions: Upload a picture of their signature or a PDF of the signed document. This proves they agreed to the terms.

fields.label: Agreement Datetime
fields.name: starmus_agreement_datetime
fields.instructions: The exact date and time when they agreed to the terms. Pick from the calendar and clock.

fields.label: Submission ID
fields.name: starmus_submission_id
fields.instructions: A tracking number for this specific submission. This helps us keep records organized.

fields.label: Signatory IP
fields.name: starmus_contributor_ip
fields.instructions: The internet address (IP address) of the person who signed. Looks like: 192.168.1.1. This helps verify who signed.

fields.label: User Agent
fields.name: starmus_contributor_user_agent
fields.instructions: Information about what web browser and device they used to sign. For example: Chrome on iPhone. Saved automatically.

fields.label: Signatory Geolocation
fields.name: starmus_contributor_geolocation
fields.instructions: The location on a map where they were when they signed the agreement. This helps verify the signature.

fields.label: Transcription Text
fields.name: starmus_transcription_text
fields.instructions: Type or paste the written text of everything said in the audio recording. Include all words spoken.

fields.label: Time-Indexed Data (JSON)
fields.name: starmus_transcription_json
fields.instructions: Computer data that connects specific words to exact times in the audio. This lets you click a word and jump to that part. Created automatically.

fields.label: Original Language
fields.name: starmus_original_language
fields.instructions: What language was spoken in the original recording? For example: English, Spanish, Mandarin.

fields.label: Translation Language
fields.name: starmus_translation_language
fields.instructions: If this text has been changed to a different language, select that language here. Leave blank if same as original.

fields.label: Linked Audio
fields.name: starmus_linked_audio
fields.instructions: Connect this written text to the audio recording it came from. Pick the recording from the list.

fields.label: Method
fields.name: starmus_transcription_method

choices.human: Human Transcribed - A person listened and typed it
choices.asr: Automated (ASR) - A computer listened and typed it
choices.hybrid: AI + Human Review - Computer typed it, person checked it

fields.instructions: How was this written out? Did a person type it or did a computer do it?

fields.label: Engine/Model Info
fields.name: starmus_transcription_engine
fields.instructions: If a computer did the typing, which program was used? For example: 'Whisper' or 'Google Speech-to-Text'. Leave blank if done by hand.

fields.label: Text Content Hash
fields.name: starmus_transcription_hash
fields.instructions: A special code that proves this text hasn't been changed. Like a fingerprint for the words. Created automatically.

fields.label: Speaker Diarization Map
fields.name: starmus_speaker_map
fields.instructions: If multiple people are talking in the recording, connect the labels in the text (like 'Speaker 1') to the real people's names.

sub_fields.label: Label in Text
sub_fields.name: starmus_label
sub_fields.instructions: The name used in the transcription. For example: 'Speaker 1' or 'Interviewer'.

sub_fields.label: Actual Contributor
sub_fields.name: starmus_contributor
sub_fields.instructions: Who is this speaker? Pick the real person from the Contributors list.

fields.label: Translation Text
fields.name: starmus_translation_text
fields.instructions: Type or paste the text that has been changed into the new language. This should say the same thing as the original, just in different words.

fields.label: Target Language
fields.name: starmus_target_language
fields.instructions: What language has the text been changed into? For example: If translating English to Spanish, pick Spanish here.

fields.label: Linked Audio
fields.name: starmus_linked_audio
fields.instructions: Connect this translated text to the original audio recording. Pick the recording from the list.

fields.label: Translation Type
fields.name: starmus_translation_type

choices.localized: Localized / Cultural - Adapted for meaning and culture
choices.back_trans: Back-Translation - Changed back to check accuracy

fields.instructions: How was the text translated? Was it word-for-word, or was it adapted to sound natural in the new language?

fields.label: Back-Translation Verification
fields.name: starmus_back_translation_text
fields.instructions: To check accuracy, translate this back to the original language and paste it here. This helps us see if the meaning stayed the same.

fields.label: Source Transcription
fields.name: starmus_transcription_parent
fields.instructions: If this translation came from a written transcription, connect it here. Pick the transcription from the list.

fields.label: Translation Hash
fields.name: starmus_translation_hash
fields.instructions: A special code that proves this translated text hasn't been changed. Like a fingerprint for the words. Created automatically.

fields.label: Sample Rate
fields.name: starmus_sample_rate
fields.instructions: How many times per second was the sound captured? Higher numbers mean better quality but bigger files. 44.1 kHz is CD quality.

fields.label: Bit Depth
fields.name: starmus_bit_depth
fields.instructions: How much detail is captured in each sound sample? Higher numbers mean more detail and better quality. 16-bit is CD quality.

fields.label: Tuning Frequency
fields.name: starmus_tuning_hz
fields.instructions: What pitch was used to tune the instruments? Usually 440Hz (standard concert pitch). Leave as 440Hz unless you know it's different.

fields.label: Channel Layout
fields.name: starmus_channel_layout

choices.mono: Mono - Single speaker, all sound in one channel
choices.stereo: Stereo - Two speakers, left and right

fields.instructions: How many speakers is this recording made for? Mono = 1, Stereo = 2 (most common), Surround = multiple speakers all around.

fields.label: Tempo (BPM)
fields.name: starmus_bpm
fields.instructions: How fast is the song? BPM means Beats Per Minute. Slow songs are 60-90 BPM. Fast songs are 120-180 BPM.

fields.label: Musical Key
fields.name: starmus_musical_key
fields.instructions: What musical key is the song in? This tells what notes sound best together. Ask a musician if you're not sure.

fields.label: ISRC Code
fields.name: starmus_isrc_code
fields.instructions: The official tracking code for this song when it's sold. Format: CC-XXX-YY-NNNNN (example: US-S1Z-17-12345). Get this from your distributor.

fields.label: Instrumentation List
fields.name: starmus_instrumentation
fields.instructions: List all the instruments played in this recording and who played them. Add one row for each instrument.

sub_fields.label: Instrument
sub_fields.name: starmus_instrument
sub_fields.instructions: Name of the instrument. For example: Guitar, Piano, Drums, Violin.

sub_fields.label: Performer
sub_fields.name: starmus_performer
sub_fields.instructions: Who played this instrument? Pick the musician from the Contributors list.

fields.label: Stem Bundle URI
fields.name: starmus_stems_cloud_uri
fields.instructions: A web link to download the separate audio tracks (like just the drums, just the vocals). Created automatically when stems are uploaded.

fields.label: DAW Project Link
fields.name: starmus_daw_project_uri
fields.instructions: A link to the original project file from music software like Pro Tools, Logic, or Ableton. This lets you edit the song later.

fields.label: Loudness (LUFS)
fields.name: starmus_integrated_lufs
fields.instructions: How loud the song sounds to your ears. Streaming services like Spotify want around -14.0 LUFS. Ask your audio engineer for this number.

fields.label: Songwriter Splits
fields.name: starmus_publishing_splits
fields.instructions: Who wrote the song? List everyone who wrote the music or lyrics and how much of the songwriting money each person gets. All percentages should add up to 100%.

sub_fields.label: Contributor
sub_fields.name: starmus_contributor
sub_fields.instructions: Pick the songwriter from the Contributors list.

sub_fields.label: Role
sub_fields.name: starmus_role

choices.comp_lyr: Composer-Lyricist - Wrote both music and words
choices.translator: Translator - Adapted lyrics to new language

sub_fields.instructions: What part of the song did they write?

sub_fields.label: Share %
sub_fields.name: starmus_share_percentage
sub_fields.instructions: What percent of songwriting money do they get? All shares must add up to 100%.

fields.label: Master Splits
fields.name: starmus_master_splits
fields.instructions: Who owns this specific recording? List everyone who owns part of this recording and what percentage they get. All percentages should add up to 100%.

sub_fields.label: Contributor
sub_fields.name: starmus_contributor
sub_fields.instructions: Pick the owner from the Contributors list.

sub_fields.label: Role
sub_fields.name: starmus_role

choices.engineer: Engineer - Recorded and mixed the audio
choices.session_mus: Session Musician - Played instruments on recording

sub_fields.instructions: What was their job on this recording?

sub_fields.label: Share %
sub_fields.name: starmus_share_percentage
sub_fields.instructions: What percent of recording money do they get? All shares must add up to 100%.

fields.label: UPC/EAN
fields.name: starmus_upc_code
fields.instructions: The barcode number for the whole album or single. Usually 12 or 13 digits. For example: 012345678905. Get this from your distributor.

fields.label: Catalog Number
fields.name: starmus_catalog_number
fields.instructions: Your record label's internal tracking number for this release. Like a library call number but for your music catalog.

fields.label: Release Type
fields.name: starmus_release_type
fields.instructions: What kind of release is this? Pick based on how many songs are included.

fields.label: Street Date
fields.name: starmus_release_date
fields.instructions: The date when this music becomes available to the public. Pick the official release date from the calendar.

fields.label: Record Label / Imprint
fields.name: starmus_label_name
fields.instructions: The name of the record label or company publishing this music. For example: 'Atlantic Records' or 'Self-Released'.

fields.label: Tracks
fields.name: starmus_tracklist
fields.instructions: List all the songs on this release in the order they should play. Add one row for each song.

sub_fields.label: No.
sub_fields.name: starmus_track_number
sub_fields.instructions: Track number: 1, 2, 3, etc.

sub_fields.label: Recording Link
sub_fields.name: starmus_recording
sub_fields.instructions: Pick the audio recording that goes here. Select the song from the list.

sub_fields.label: Media Side
sub_fields.name: starmus_side
sub_fields.instructions: Which side of the record or which disc is this on? Usually used for vinyl or multi-disc releases.

sub_fields.label: ISRC Override
sub_fields.name: starmus_isrc_override
sub_fields.instructions: Only fill this if the track has a different ISRC code than what's on the recording. Leave blank to use the recording's ISRC.

sub_fields.label: Explicit Content
sub_fields.name: starmus_is_explicit
sub_fields.instructions: Turn this on if the song has curse words or adult content. This adds the Explicit warning label.
